properties.areaDesc: Madison, AL; Limestone, AL; Lincoln, TN
properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 5 at 10:18PM CST until February 6 at 12:15AM CST by NWS Huntsville AL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Huntsville Alabama has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Northwestern Madison County in north central Alabama...
Northeastern Limestone County in north central Alabama...
Southern Lincoln County in Middle Tennessee...

* Until 1215 AM CST.

* At 1018 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing
heavy rainfall training across the warning area. Between 2 and 4
inches of rain have already fallen, and with an additional 2 to 4
inches of rain expected to fall in a very short amount time, flash
flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Expect rapidly
rising and swiftly flowing water to create life threatening flash
flooding in this region!

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Athens, Fayetteville, Ardmore, Lincoln, Elkmont, Mulberry,
Cartwright, Elkwood, Belleview and Cash Point.
properties.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring.
If you are in the warned area move to higher ground immediately.
Residents living along streams and creeks should take immediate
precautions to protect life and property.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 12:15 AM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
